question.text: Which of the following option justify that why bacteria are useful in genetic engineering?

options.text: They are very small. They do not need large containers. They have no mitochondria.
They reproduce asexually. They can double their numbers in twenty minutes in good conditions. They have cell walls.
They have the same genetic code as other organisms. They have plasmids. There can multiply faster.
Their DNA is not in a nucleus. They have a cell membrane. They have a large surface area to volume ratio.

solution.text:
Bacteria act as a useful tool in biotechnology because:

The genetic code has been universal, the basic structure of genetic material is the same. They are simple organisms and easy to manipulate; also, they multiply at a rapid rate. They have extrachromosomal DNA called plasmids which can be used as a vector in genetic engineering
